DataElement.preferredName: Treating Physician Current Clinical Treatment Consent Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the treating physician is willing to administer treatment to the patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treating Physician Current Clinical Treatment Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the consent of a treating physician (the physician who directly administers medical aid to a patient or study subject) to provide clinical treatment (the treatment of disease in patients including experimental treatment) as part of the current clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The physician who directly administers medical aid to a patient or study subject.

Concepts.definition: The physician who directly administers medical aid to a patient or study subject.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:Actual observation and treatment of disease in patients (including experimental treatment) as distinct from theoretical or experimental work.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
Actual observation and treatment of disease in patients (including experimental treatment) as distinct from theoretical or experimental work.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
